faqDesc: Frequently asked questions (FAQs ) lists are frequently found in articles, websites, email lists, and online forums, where frequent questions are repeated. The purpose of Frequently Asked Questions is to provide information about questions or concerns that are usually frequent; however, the format is a useful means of organizing information, and a text consisting of questions and their answers can be called a FAQ regardless of whether questions are frequently asked in reality.

about_items.item4: The main directions of the foundation

section1.ptext: The board of trustees is supreme part of "Vatandoshlar" public foundation.  The board of trustees consists of 17 people.
section1.ptext1: One of the main activities of the foundation is the establishment and development of cooperation with compatriots living abroad and the public associations created by them. Therefore, to encourage the activities of public associations created by compatriots, to provide them with practical assistance in creating Uzbek national cultural centers abroad, to support and develop the Uzbek language, culture and traditions abroad in cooperation with associations of compatriots. to support and popularize the rich scientific, cultural and spiritual heritage of our country abroad, to help compatriots in organizing cultural and educational events.

section2.ptext1-1: One of the main goals of the Foundation is to further embed compatriots living abroad around their historical homeland, raise their sense of pride in the country in their hearts and minds, preserve national identity, support compatriots and public associations formed by them, and effectively direct the potential of our compatriots operating in various fields to the development of our country.
section2.ptext1-4: Further embed compatriots living abroad around their historical homeland, exalting in their hearts and minds a sense of pride in the land.
section2.htext2: About the foundation and history of Fonding
section2.p-text2: Further embed compatriots living abroad around their historical homeland, exalting in their hearts and minds a sense of pride in the land. About the formation and history of Fondnig, further embezzlement of compatriots living abroad around their historical homeland, exaltation of a sense of pride in the land in their hearts and minds, preservation of national identity, support of compatriots and their compatriots and the deputy chairman of the board to further embezzle compatriots living abroad around their historical homeland, exalting a sense of pride in the land in their hearts and minds, , one of the main goals of the Foundation is the effective orientation of the potential of our compatriots operating in various fields to the development of our country. One of the main goals of the Foundation is to further embed compatriots living abroad around their historical homeland, raise their sense of pride in the country in their hearts and minds, maintain national identity, support compatriots and public associations formed by them, and effectively direct the potential of our compatriots operating in various fields to the development of our country. Sattarov Odiljon Berdimuradovich Tursunov Rovshan Khamidullayevich

section3.htext1: Main areas of activity of the foundation
section3.card1-left: Establishment and development of cooperation with public associations
section3.card2-left: Preservation and development of Uzbek language, culture and traditions
section3.card3-left: Expansion of contractual-legal cooperation in the fields of migration and education
section3.card4-left: Promotion of the activities of Public Associations organized by compatriots
section3.card5-left: Assistance to compatriots in organizing cultural and educational events
section3.card6-left: Support our compatriots for scientific, creative research aimed at increasing the prestige of our country
section3.card1-right: Assistance in the protection of the rights and freedoms of compatriots assistance in the protection of the rights and freedoms of compatriots
section3.card2-right: Wide promotion of the rich scientific, cultural and spiritual heritage of our country
section3.card3-right: Assistance in providing social support and legal assistance to compatriots who are in a difficult life situation
section3.card4-right: Providing practical assistance in establishing Uzbek national cultural centers abroad
section3.card5-right: Support our compatriots to receive education in the direction of Uzbek language in higher educational institutions of the Republic
section3.card6-right: Active involvement of compatriots in business, investment, scientific, cultural and educational activities on the territory of Uzbekistan

section3-1.htext1: About the foundation and history of Fondnig
section3-1.ptext1: Further embalming compatriots living abroad around their historical homeland, exalting a sense of pride in the land in their hearts and minds, maintaining a national identity, further embalming compatriots and compatriots living abroad by them around their historical homeland, exalting a sense of pride in the land in their hearts and minds, maintaining a national identity, supporting compatriots and public associations formed by them, one of the main goals of the Foundation is the effective orientation of the potential of our compatriots operating in various fields to the development of our country. One of the main goals of the Foundation is to further embed compatriots living abroad around their historical homeland, raise their sense of pride in the country in their hearts and minds, preserve national identity, support compatriots and public associations formed by them, and effectively direct the potential of our compatriots operating in various fields to the development of our country.

section4.carda: Chief expert on information technology and electronic portal
section4.cardsh: Chief specialist in strategic analysis and planning
section4.cardv: Chief specialist in material and social support of compatriots
section4.cardv2: Head of relations with compatriot organizations
section4.cardmm: Chief specialist in the organization of cultural and educational events

section5.htext1: Our supreme goal is to unite compatriots abroad around their Motherland, to raise the feeling of pride in the country in their hearts and minds, and to preserve the national identity!

symbols.anthem: State anthem of the Republic of Uzbekistan
symbols.text: Law"on the state anthem of the Republic of Uzbekistan" dated December 10, 1992. The Supreme Council of the Republic ofiningo was adopted at its first session
symbols.author: Mutal Burhonov music-Abdulla Oripov may refer to
symbols.textsOne:
My country, sunny and free, salvation to your people,
You are a warmhearted companion to the friends!
symbols.textsTwo:
Belief of generous Uzbek does not die out,
Free, young children are a strong wing for you!
symbols.textsThree:
These golden valleys – dear Uzbekistan,
Manly spirit of ancestors is companion to you!
symbols.textsFour:
When the great power of people became exuberant
You are the country that amazes the world!
symbols.textsFive:
Belief of generous Uzbek does not die out,
Free, young children are a strong wing for you!
symbols.textsSix:
The torch of independence, guardian of peace,
Just motherland be eternally prosperous!
symbols.coat: Coat of arms of the Republic of Uzbekistan
symbols.coatAbout:
The law "on the state coat of arms of the Republic of Uzbekistan" was adopted on July 2, 1992 at The X session of the Supreme Council of the Republic of Uzbekistan. The state emblem of the Republic of Uzbekistan from the image of the sun shining over the valley in which it blooms
also on the left side are wheat cobs, and on the right side open cotton swabs consist of an interroom with water drop.
symbols.coats: At the top of the coat of arms, an eight-pointed star is depicted as a symbol of the Republican Jeeps: a crescent moon and a star, located within eight edges, are symbols of the salvation of Muslims.
symbols.coatCenter: In the center of the coat of arms is inscribed the wings of the legendary Humo Bird, a symbol of himmat, nobility and self-sacrifice. These symbols and symbols represent the aspirations of our people on the path to peace, good, happiness, prosperity.
symbols.coatUzb: At the bottom of the coat of arms is inscribed "Uzbekistan” on the band of the chambar ribbon representing the state flag of the Republic.

term.use: TERMS OF USE OF THE SITE:
term.ones: 1.1. The website www.vatandoshlarfondi.uz  (here in after referred to as the "website") is the property of the "Vatandoshlar" public foundation (here in after referred to as the "Foundation") and the use of the website is governed by the following conditions (here in after referred to as " it is called "terms of use").
term.two: 1.2. By accessing the Website, viewing its pages and using the Website, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Use and acknowledge that they are legally binding on you. Please read these terms of use carefully. If you do not agree to these terms of use, you are asked to leave the website.
term.three: 1.3. The Foundation has the right to revise, change, supplement and (or) withdraw a certain part of these terms of use at any time at its discretion. A new outdated version of these terms of use will be effective when posted on the website.
term.four: 1.4. Website management can be done from different places of the Republic of Uzbekistan. The website can be accessed from anywhere in the world.
term.five: 2.1. The Foundation is the sole owner of the intellectual property rights included in the website, in particular, the property rights to the materials posted on the website.
term.six: 2.2 Objects of intellectual property rights include, without limitation of any kind, all related objects: all texts, graphic materials, user and visual interfaces, photographs, images, illustrations, logos, layout, video recordings, audio recordings, sound, music, design, know-how , technology, drawings, pictorial and other materials published on the website, authorship, as well as rights or forms of protection created by the employees of the Foundation.
term.seven: 3.1. The information posted on the website is provided for informational purposes only.
term.eight: 3.2. The information provided is for personal use only. Do not use the site in any way that can cause termination, overloading, damage or other negative consequences, and also do not interfere with the ability of third parties to work with the site, including in real time.
term.nine: 3.3. Do not use robots or other automatic devices, methods or tools to access the site for any purpose, including monitoring and copying materials posted on the site.
term.ten: 3.4. You may download, display or print the information posted on the website for your personal, non-commercial use only. Downloading or copying of the document or software on the website does not give you any rights to the related document or software.
term.eleven: 4.1. Errors in the information posted on the Foundation's website (methodical, spelling, technical and other errors) may be changed by the Foundation without notice.
term.twelve: 4.2. The Foundation's website may contain links to other websites. The Fund is not responsible for the accuracy and truthfulness of the information on these links.

BayroqTwo: State flag of the Republic of Uzbekistan
BayroqThree: The Law on the State Flag of the Republic of Uzbekistan was adopted on November 18, 1991 at the extraordinary VII session of the Supreme Council of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
BayroqFive: The flag and its symbol represent the historical connection with the countries that existed in the past on the borders of today's Uzbekistan and embody the national and cultural traditions of the republic.
BayroqSeven: The blue color is a symbol of the eternal sky and nature, reflecting the essence of life. In the language of symbols, it means goodness, wisdom, honesty, glory and loyalty. Therefore, the color of Amir Temur's state was also blue.
BayroqEight: white color is a symbol of sacred peace, which blends with daylight and cosmic lights. White color is a symbol of purity, innocence, purity, purity of dreams and dreams, striving for inner beauty.
BayroqTen: color is a symbol of renewal of nature. It is a symbol of happiness, hope and joy in many nations.
BayroqTwelf: lines represent the rivulets of life force flowing in our body. The current image of the crescent moon is associated with our historical traditions. At the same time, it is a symbol of our independence.
Bayroq14: he was considered a priest, a divine symbol for all. The image of 12 stars on the State flag of the Republic of Uzbekistan is also directly related to our historical traditions and ancient annals. Our attention to the twelve stars is also explained by the development of astrology in the scientific thinking of the ancient countries on the border of Uzbekistan.
Bayroq15: The image of 12 stars on our flag should be understood as a symbol of the antiquity of the culture of the Uzbek people, their pursuit of perfection and happiness in their own land.
